title: AnnexRepo.add() ignores symlinks on Windows (GitRepo.add() works)
body:
Demo:

This is a function from datalad-revolution that failed in https://ci.appveyor.com/project/mih/datalad-revolution/builds/19855520 in the analog of this test of `add`: https://github.com/datalad/datalad/blob/84f44bc882f01f4e3a4c28bff92a6cb7e6f1fc69/datalad/distribution/tests/test_add.py#L436
```
(Pdb) ds.repo.save()
*** datalad.support.exceptions.FileNotInRepositoryError: FileNotInRepositoryErro
r: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'commit', '-m',
 'dryrun', '--dry-run', '--no-status', '--', 'symlink']' failed with exitcode 1
File(s) unknown to git
[Errno 1] ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'commit', '-m', '
dryrun', '--dry-run', '--no-status', '--', 'symlink']: File(s) unknown to git: ''
```
We are on windows:
```
(Pdb) path
'C:\\Users\\appveyor\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\1\\datalad_temp_yhax7f_o'
```
The reason is that AnnexRepo.add() simply ignores the presence of the symlink, and does nothing (not error), and subsequently `Repo.commit()` fails, because it tries to commit something that had not been added yet.
```
(Pdb) ds.repo.add('symlink')
[]
```
In contrast, `GitRepo.add()` does the right thing (for this demo, the symlink was unstaged in a separate console session before this next line.
```
(Pdb) from datalad .support.gitrepo import GitRepo
(Pdb) GitRepo.add(ds.repo, files='symlink')
{'success': True, 'file': 'symlink'}
```

I am aware that this test is not even considered as part of the -core Windows tests, but -revolution is using this function still, and its failure seems to be the last issues before achieving full symlink capability on windows in -revolution -- hence reporting it here.
